We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

The Opportunity:
 CACI's Business and Information Technology Solutions (BITS) Sector is seeking data analytics support for the Navy’s Chief Information Officer (CIO) for the MyNavy HR enterprise who is responsible for executing the development and sustainment of all information technology (IT) capabilities supporting OPNAV N1. The CIO ensures that IT architecture, solutions, data, and operational performance efficiently meets the evolving mission and business needs across the entire MyNavy HR enterprise. If you are a motivated individual looking to be a part of a critical mission, CACI would like to speak to you!
 Responsibilities:
 You will be responsible for maintaining knowledge of online analytical processing (OLAP) tools. Gathers analytical requirements working with subject management experts. Develops data frameworks for data analysis to support end-user data discovery. Designs and develops data models that optimize analytical reporting performance. Develops data extraction, transformation, cleansing, and loading processes between transactional and analytical systems. Builds reports, dashboards, and OLAP databases to support end-user reporting and information requirements. Performs statistical analyses on data and predictive forecasting. Analyzes and interprets results using statistical techniques. Interpret trends or patterns in complex and data sets.
 You will support MyNavy HR functional data management, data governance, and business intelligence and analytics. Review current practices in how data is procured, stored, managed, interpreted, analyzed, applied, and disposed of and ensure that those practices are aligned with ethical principles or core concepts such as “Impact on people, potential for misuse, and the economic value of data” as defined in the DAMA-DMBOK. You will identify relevant data security requirements, define data security policy and standards, assess current security risks and implement controls and procedures. Plan, analyze, develop, and design data integration and interoperability solutions. Implement, and control activities necessary to store, protect, and access data found within electronic files and physical records (including graphics and images {e.g. scanned service record documents}. May also manage database operations to include planning for continuity, developing instances, monitoring performance, testing, and migration. Develop and implement the techniques, processes, and policies necessary for the collection (Big Data) and analysis (Data Science, Analytics and Visualization) of many different types of data.
 Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science, mathematics, statistics, business, engineering, or physical science.
 Six Years General Experience: Data Analysis, and/or Statistical Analysis, Problem Solving, and/or Content Management, and/or Software and Network Programming and/or Information Assurance, and/or Cybersecurity, and/or Electronic Documentation and/or Data Standardization and/or Electronic Documentation, and/or System Administration, and/or Network Administration, and/or Systems Testing, and/or Database Administration.
 Specific Experience:
Data Governance, Data Quality, and/or Test Data Management, Data and/or Architecture, and/or Data Security Programing (SQL, JAVA, Python, R), and/or Data Analysis Software (e.g., Excel, SAS, SPSS), and/or Knowledge of Database Query Language (e.g., SQL), and/or Report Creation and Data Visualization (Tableau and R Studio) Understanding of Statistical Methods and Techniques to Analyze Data, DoD Risk Management Framework (RMF), Managing Enterprise Level Cross Functional Teams.


______________________________________________________________________________

 What You Can Expect:

 A culture of integrity.
At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you’ll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer’s missions and driven by a higher purpose – to ensure the safety of our nation.

 An environment of trust.
CACI takes pride in fostering a diverse and accessible culture where every individual feels supported to chart their own path. You’ll have the autonomy to take the time you need through a unique flexible time off benefit and have access to robust learning resources to make your ambitions a reality.

 A focus on continuous growth.
Together, we will advance our nation's most critical missions, build on our lengthy track record of business success, and find opportunities to break new ground — in your career and in our legacy.

 Your potential is limitless. So is ours.

Lead data analytics initiatives and drive decisions at the solution level to support client needs
Be hands-on and develop reports, dashboards, scorecards and data visualizations
Be a self-driven, motivated individual assisting in managing multiple projects and priorities simultaneously
Act as a trusted advisor building strong relationships and communicating effectively with clients and colleagues at all levels
Utilize your passion for leading and mentoring junior team members

 Responsibilities:

Work collaboratively with different client and Triverus teams and provide direction and best practice recommendations from strategy through implementation
Lead the analysis and design of data solutions including cloud and/or on-premise business intelligence and data integration solutions
Leverage your experiences and expertise to support and bring value to our Three Truths: clients, colleagues, and community.

 Technologies: ‍
 ‍You have experience working with the latest data analytics and visualization technologies and tools, including but not limited to Tableau, Power BI, Qlik and Alteryx. You possess an interest in learning new technologies and understanding both their benefits and limitations to support client needs. Advanced knowledge of SQL is also required. Experience with databases, big data and data integration tools is beneficial.


 Who You Are
 A Leader: You are skilled in the art of motivating a group of people to act towards achieving a common goal. When you see a ball on the ground you pick it up and run with it.
 Motivated: You want to analyze and solve complex problems to help clients achieve their goals.
 Ambitious: You are excited about learning new technologies and business concepts either through hands-on project work or professional development/training, and are always looking to progress to the next level either through your technical skills, project responsibilities, and more senior roles.
 Transparent: You are thorough in presenting and communicating your work and the needs of a project with your peers, leadership and client teams.
 A Team Player: You are looking for an environment where you have a chance to both learn from your colleagues and to help them expand their skills wherever you can.
 Entrepreneurial: You are interested in making an impact on the overall development of the company. Triverus is a growing company where input from colleagues is critical to our success!
 Why Work With Us?
Benefit from the experience of working in a diverse set of roles at many clients in multiple industries and technologies all local to Boston.
We are a new and growing company where your input will be highly valued. You will work with a great group of colleagues who genuinely like helping each other, and who want to make a difference in their communities and at their clients while also having fun.
Great benefits including bonus, profit sharing, 401k, health and wellness, flexible PTO and never work on your birthday.


 About Triverus
Triverus is an IT Consulting Services firm focused on helping clients transform their information into business value. Triverus was founded based on a desire to enhance the value inherent in our clients, colleagues and community—our "three truths".
 Clients: We strive to create a differentiated experience for our clients through sustained delivery and consistent client services. We invest the time to build trusting relationships with our clients that are based on results and a deep caring for their success.
 Colleagues: Enjoying what we do and the people we work with are core to Triverus. Our colleagues seek to make a difference while having fun. Bringing together talented, like-minded people from diverse backgrounds is core to the Triverus culture, which is based on respect for the individual, both personally and professionally.
 Communities: The Triverus community is committed to enhancing the world around us by participating in a diverse set of communities. Whether it be professional groups, charities, local municipalities or school systems, we all gain from participating. Diversity of ideas enhances the value for all.
 Triverus Services
Our services focus on ensuring that our clients obtain lasting value as quickly as possible and include:

Roadmaps & Business Agility
Applied AI & Workforce Innovation
Data Analytics & Information Optimization
Technology Services
Applied Industry Expertise in Life Sciences and Public Sector

Delivery of our services leverages expertise across the disciplines of architecture, development, management, analysis and quality.


 


Interested in applying?
Send your resume to beacolleague@triverusconsulting.com

The Finance Analyst for Cytiva is a role that is responsible for providing financial leadership for the organization within the Cell Culture business. The role serves as a business partner to the Product Management team driving growth, business initiatives, and profitability.

This position is part of the Cell Culture Media business located in Logan, UT. At Cytiva, our vision is to advance future therapeutics from discovery to delivery.

 What you will do:

Partner with product managers, leaders and commercial teams. Providing top line analytics, including top customer sales trends, weekly & monthly projections, and bookings & funnel reviews

Drive data analysis, ad hoc solutions, and business case development for key projects and their impact to the performance of the business.

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration.

Clear thinking and problem solving: successfully driven cross-functional project improvements within broader business operations.
Strong analytical & PC skills: ability to work with big data and pull out the important facts, problems, trends, and present key findings.
Excellent communication skills: experience working across multiple functions and regions; able to clearly communicate complex financial information in an easy to understand manner.


 It would be a plus if you also possess or have previous experience in:

CPA, MBA, or MS in Operations management, Supply Chain, or Finance

 Job Title: Sr Data Analyst Overview: 
 
  EverWatch is a government solutions company providing advanced defense, intelligence, and deployed support to our country’s most critical missions. We are a full-service government solutions company. Harnessing the most advanced technology and solutions, we strengthen defenses and control environments to preserve continuity and ensure mission success.
 


 EverWatch employees are focused on tackling the most difficult challenges of the US Government. We offer the best salaries and benefits packages in our industry - to identify and retain the top talent in support of our critical mission objectives.
 


 As data analyst, you love diving into data and turning it into meaningful insights. With the abundance of structured and unstructured data, you understand the importance of transforming complex data sets into useful information to solve challenges. As a data analyst at Booz Allen, you can use your skills and experience to support a mission and use data for good. We need a data expert like you to bring your expertise to help clients make the most of their data.
 

  As a client-facing data analyst on our National Security team, you’ll work closely with your clients to understand their questions and needs and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. Not nly will you provide a deep understanding of their data, but you’ll also advise your client on what the information means and how it can be used to make an impact on their cybersecurity mission.
 
 Responsibilities: 
 
  Identifies and collects data sources, analyzes and extracts key data and information, evaluates and monitors data quality to meet the organization's information system needs and requirements. Applies advanced consulting skills and/or extensive technical expertise; full industry knowledge. Develops innovative solutions to complex problems. Works without considerable direction; mentors and may supervise team members.
 

 How You’ll Contribute: As a data analyst on our team, you’ll:



Solicit and engage with analysts across your host client team to understand data flow challenges, gaps in tool or data set knowledge, and brainstorm methods to streamline analytic workflows.
Work as part of a team with government, military, and contractor personnel across organizations to research, develop, optimize, test, and document data-related tradecraft, leverage and utilize data source acquisitions and accesses, and troubleshoot data flow issues related to mission needs.
Generate solutions through the collection, interpretation, evaluation, and analysis of large data sets.
Apply consulting and communication skills and data analytics expertise by simplifying technical requirements and trends, based on audience.
Present data findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders using your knowledge of databases, scripting languages such as Python, and Microsoft Office Suite.
Establish quantitative and qualitative metrics and key performance indicators to drive technical outcomes.
Grow your communication and technical skills by merging consulting and big data to create data-centric solutions.
Use your data analytics expertise to support client and stakeholder relationships.
Explore, propose, and justify the use of new data sources to customers.
Explain currently available data sources’ ability to enhance mission outcomes.
Work with us to drive large-scale business and process decisions through data insights.
Join us. The world can’t wait.


 Qualifications: 
  You Have: .




5+ years of experience with classified, collateral, and OSINT data sources and query functionalities
Experience developing fingerprints, microplugins, analytics, and notebooks using client discovery and analytic tools
Experience converting data into various formats and preserving meaning
Experience as a cyber analyst, including TDNA or DNEA
Knowledge of Python and regex
Ability to select data, join, and enrich various datasets
Ability to communicate technical information and recommendations to peers, engineers, and analytic customers
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
Bachelors degree and 5+ years directly related experience or Masters degree and 3+ years directly related experience



 Nice If You Have:



Knowledge of NiagaraFiles


 Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance with polygraph is required.

Position Summary:
The senior data analyst is responsible for advancing process improvements to increase the speed in which the data collection team organizes and analyzes data to ensure consistent, timely and accurate data that the business can rely on for quality reporting when planning, forecasting, and doing other various data driven business decisions. This role requires the senior analyst to be the first point of contact to train the data analysts on existing processes and processes being improved. This position is also responsible for creating and updating training material including SOPs, MU courses, and any additional presentations needed for training. The senior data analyst works with large data sets that require problem-solving skills and the ability to identify and determines best practices to develop better insights for current business processes. This position is required to thoroughly understand the various reporting and data systems within Monster and make recommendations for improvements as necessary, with key focus on volume reporting reconciliation and call point management. The senior data collection analyst acts as a subject matter expert on various business initiatives to provide guidance as necessary for data collection and the governance of. This role mentors a small team of data analyst.
 Essential Job Functions:

Develop and/or improve standardized audits and information processes to promote data reporting accuracy, consistency, and integrity
Develop and execute solutions with customer account manager (e.g. National Account, Regional Account Team) and finance partners in order to meet identified business needs
Establish positive working relationships with internal and external constituents
Run periodic queries using the appropriate reporting systems to create and distribute reports.
Review methodology, inputs, and compliance with policies and procedures to ensure accuracy of reporting.
Managing processes related to the validation of sales volume and other data elements from Distributors, Retailers, and various 3rd Parties
Development and maintenance of Customer Hierarchies that enable functions such as, sales reporting and financial accruals, etc.
Protect information provided in confidence from outside sources (bottlers and other business partners) and ensure this information is not disseminated to any unauthorized parties.
Protect information and materials provided to third parties (e.g., consultants, vendors, suppliers, bottlers) by ensuring appropriate procedures are followed and parties are bound by company confidentiality agreements as necessary
Create and distribute ad-hoc reports, standard reports, and dashboards based on requestor’s detailed requirements.
Meet with constituents to understand needs, finds ways to resolve issues, and creatively offers solutions to complex business opportunities.
Participate in team meetings and make recommendations to improve processes.
Business and technical issue resolution - identify and mitigate issues, working with stakeholders on resolutions as needed
Use large sets of data to identify and resolve issues before they have an adverse effect
Review and explain technical requirements to internal and external customers
Cultivate a positive working relationship with bottlers and internal teams
Identify, research, and communicate data related issues to the necessary parties for proper resolution
Supports Leadership with ad-hock assignments

Position Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree required, preferably in statistics, computer science, or business administration
Proficient in macro development, data software’s and programs (VBA and SQL)
3+ years of in-depth analytical experience and use of reporting tools and data large data sets
Proficiency in using spreadsheets to arrange, manipulate, format, and prepare large amounts of information.
Highly effective analytical and problem-solving skills - Sees multiple relationships between different sources of data, identifying several likely causes or consequences of a situation.
Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Access, Word etc.), PowerBI
Thorough understanding of Big Data Analytics and processes
Possesses strong leadership potential
High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to identify issues within highly detailed data
Conceptual Thinking – ability to see patterns or trends in data or situations
Ability to respond to ad hoc requests accurately and in a timely manner
Ability to use and learn a variety of query and reporting tools
Must be adaptable, able to handle unexpected challenges, coordinate across multiple individuals and teams, and appropriately prioritize the needs of the department
Able to manipulate large amounts of non-standard data using Excel into a standard format
Proficient level of business English usage, spelling, grammar, and punctuation
Establish, cultivate, and maintain positive and beneficial working relationships with others
Providing excellent customers service with both internal and external stakeholders
Strong organizational and analytical skills; decision making and problem solving
Effective communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
Good time management skills
Strong multi-tasking abilities
